snippet: The president said his strategy for defeating the Islamic State is working and that turning away Syrian refugees based on religion would be un-American.
abstract: Pres Obama claims strategy of airstrikes and assisting local forces has been effective in weakening Islamic State, despite terrorist attacks in Paris claimed by group; defends decision not to send ground troops or act under political pressure while critics, especially Republicans, accuse him of underestimating seriousness of threat.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and PETER BAKER
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Antalya, and Peter Baker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The president said his strategy for defeating the Islamic State is working and that turning away Syrian refugees based on religion would be un-American.

headline.main: Obama Says Strategy to Fight ISIS Will Succeed
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Strategy Against Militants Will Work

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
